1421.content:
The day for Naruto Uzumako had started out perfectly normal until he brought a shiny pink stone from a little store that catered to tourists. At least, that was what he had thought at the time. He had found it on her way back to the hotel from a short little trip to the small village's grocery store. Sakura had been too busy with a book, Sai was clueless, and Captain Yamato and Kakashi were, well...

The man and his wife had seemed happy to show it to him, and had even wrapped it in a small box, though he had not asked for one. The man and his wife, his very hot, not very smart looking bride who had appeared to her to be very, very pregnant, had told him it was a good luck charm, and a shinobi like him needed all the luck he could get. Naruto hadn't thought much of it at the time, except to think that it was a little odd that they had given him the little stone for free.

Now, eyeing the little paper, he wasn't so sure.

The handwriting was very rushed, and naruto could barely make it out.

"I'm sorry," it read, "but I had to get rid of this! This is a wishing stone! It grants all of your wishes! Beware!"

A wishing stone? he thought. Who the hell would believe that? It had to be a joke!

It would be fun to try it out, he thought. Does she make a serious wish? Or a funny wish? A sexy wish?

Naruto scratched his head. What a weird little stone.

He sat on the hotel bed and looked over the stone. It was a pretty little stone, but what an odd thing to sell now that he thought about it.

"Hmm, what should I wish for first?"

He stood up and went to the window. The street below was busy and packed with people, but he could make out Sakura's pink hair as she made her way through the crowd.

A thought came to him, though why he thought of it he couldn't say.

"Let's try this: I wish that Sakura thought she was a really old lady."

He kept his eyes on Sakura, waiting for the change.

XXX


It had been a good day for Sakura. A little bit of reading, a little bit of shopping, and now back to the hotel to get ready for dinner. It had been an easy mission, all in all, but Sakura was ready for a little bit of true relaxation. She...

She stopped. Something...something was wrong...

She...

She looked around her, at all the young people around her. They were moving so fast. She missed the days when she could move so fast, when her body didn't ache and bag. Sakura's posture suddenly change; she slouched over as memories changed in her mind, as the years seemed to speed by her. Does her body go through any other changes?

1423.content:
The day for Sakura Haruno had started out perfectly normal until she brought a shiny pink stone from a little store that catered to tourist. At least, that was what she had thought at the time. She had found it on her way back to the hotel from a short little trip to the small village's grocery store. Naruto could not be trusted to follow the list, Sai was clueless, and Captain Yamato and Kakashi were, well...

The man and his wife had seemed happy to show it to her, and had even wrapped it in a small box, though she had not asked for one. The man and his wife, his very pretty, slightly dim bride who had appeared to her to be very, very pregnant, had told her it was a good luck charm, and a lovely kunoichi like her needed such luck. Sakura hadn't thought much of it at the time, except to think that it was a little odd that they had given her the little stone for free.

Now, eyeing the little paper, she wasn't so sure.

The handwriting was very rushed, and Sakura could barely make it out.

A wishing stone? she thought. Who would believe such a thing?

Had the store owner thought it out, he would have explained a bit more of what the stone could do. But he had rushed to rid himself of the cursed thing, and now it was too late. It really didn't like doing so much work, but people somehow always ended up wishing for some ill-defined pregnancy wish first.

It decided seven months with one child would be more than enough for the girl.

Sakura did not notice her belly expand, her organs shift, or her breast grow heavy. She did not notice her memories change around the wish. She felt a little dizzy, a little faint, but that was it.

That was weird, she thought. She looked at the stone she held in her hand. She felt as if she was forgetting something...

"Sakura! Hey, you okay!"

It was Naruto, knocking on her door.

At least he didn't just barge in, Sakura thought. It had been a long four months since she had discovered she was pregnant, especially with Naruto barging in on her whenever they stopped in a hotel. She knew he was just overprotective, but it was really getting on her nerves.

"It's okay, Naruto," she called. "You can come in!"

He opened the door slowly, looking a little scared before he saw that, yes, everything was okay.

"Hey, you okay? Sorry I couldn't come with you shopping."

"It's okay," she said. "I might be pregnant, Naruto, but I can handle myself."

"Yeah," he still looked embarrassed. "Just maybe let one of us help you next time, okay?"

As the dinner went on, Yamato begin to feel...empty. He couldn't quite put his finger on it, like something was missing. As his head cleared and they ate, it was odd, but, no, he really did feel empty. He found himself eating more and more before he decided that he wasn't hungry. How else could someone be empty? He couldn't help but look over to his pregnant teammate. Sakura certainly wasn't empty. With her large belly and milk filled breasts, she was full. He couldn't help but envy her.

Without thinking, he rubbed his belly best he could through his vest and shirt, depressed that he could never be like her.

The feeling only increased after they left the restaurant. Seeing Sakura waddle, her large belly out and center in front of her, only made Yamato feel worse. He was so caught up in his own depression that he didn't notice the similar stares other people gave Sakura as they walked back to their motel, including from Sai.

"Yamato, Sai?" her sweet, warm voice was the only thing that got his attention. He didn't even notice that they were back in the lobby of the hotel. "You both look bothered? Why don't we have a chat in my room and see if we can fix that."

She said something to Kakashi and Naruto, but the words were lost on Yamato. What could it be? Why would she need to see them?

The walk to the room was in silence. Yamato couldn't remember where Kakashi and Naruto had gone, though he didn't think that was too important. What was important was Sakura and what she had to tell them.

"May you shut the door, Sai?" she asked, her voice still warm and sweet. Like honey, Yamato thought. Warm honey...

He supposed that maybe he should have felt aroused while he watched her remove her shirt and milking bra, but all he felt was envy at how large and milky her breasts and belly were. Even her nipples were longer and darker, just waiting for a little mouth to make a meal of them. His eyes returned to her belly, her big, beautiful belly. He couldn't look away for all the world.

"I want both of you to look at my belly," Sakura said. "Isn't is nice?"

"Yes..." he said. He didn't hear Sai say the same.

She swayed her belly just a little from side to side, their heads swaying with it.

"You both want a belly just like this, don't you?"

"Yes..."

"Remove your vests and shirts," she commanded, though her voice was still warm and sweet and covered his mind like warm honey.

They did as she commanded, quickly undressing, not caring where their shirts were.
